boardAPI

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • boardAPI.Ship

  • public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes an instance of a ship in a game of Battleship.

    Implements a ship of the kind used when playing a game of Battleship. Contains fields and methods which describe the name, size, position, orientation, and hit status of a particular ship.

    Since:
    2015-08-30
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Jason Carlson (jccarlson @ miners.utep.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ship

        public Ship(java.lang.String name,
            int size,
            int row,
            int column,
            boolean isVertical)
        Class Constructor
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ship to be constructed.
        size - The size of the ship.
        row - The row containing the top left corner of the ship.
        column - The column containing the top left corner of the ship
        isVertical - true if ship is vertically oriented, false if horizontal.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(int row,
                 int column,
                 boolean isVertical)
        Moves a ship from one location/orientation to another.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to move the upper left corner of the ship to.
        column - The column to move the upper left corner of the ship to.
        isVertical - true if ship is to be oriented vertically, false otherwise.

      • occupies

        public boolean occupies(int row,
                        int column)
        Checks whether a ship occupies a space on a board given by a row and column.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the board containing the space to check.
        column - The column of the board containing the space to check.
        Returns:
        true if the space denoted by (row,column) is occupied by this ship, false otherwise.

      • tryShot

        public boolean tryShot(int row,
                       int column)
        Fires a shot at (row, column) and returns whether this ship was hit, reflecting the change in isHit[].
        Parameters:
        row - The row at which to shoot.
        column - The column at which to shoot.
        Returns:
        true if this ship was hit, false otherwise.

      • isHit

        public boolean isHit(int i)
        Checks the isHit[] array for a hit at a particular section of the ship.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the section of the ship to check. On a grid, this section is i spaces right of (row, column) if isVertical == false, or \ i spaces below (row, column) if true.
        Returns:
        true if that grid of the ship has been hit, false otherwise.

      • isSunk

        public boolean isSunk()
        Checks whether the ship is sunk.
        Returns:
        true if all indices of isHit[] are true, false otherwise.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Getter for size.
        Returns:
        The size of the ship in grid square units.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        Getter for row.
        Returns:
        The row containing the top left corner of the ship.

      • getColumn

        public int getColumn()
        Getter for column.
        Returns:
        The column containing the top left corner of the ship.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for name.
        Returns:
        The name of the ship.

      • isVertical

        public boolean isVertical()
        Getter for isVertical.
        Returns:
        true if ship is oriented vertically, false if oriented horizontally.

      • clone

        public Ship clone()
        Creates a new ship which has the same fields as this ship.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a new Ship with the exact same field values as this one.
